snippet: Wilson won four Stanley Cups with the Detroit Red Wings in the 1950s and set an N.H.L. record by appearing in 580 consecutive games.
abstract: Johnny Wilson, All-Star forward who set a National Hockey League record by appearing in 580 consecutive games, and who won four Stanley Cups with the Detroit Red Wings in the 1950s, dies at age 82.
lead_paragraph: Wilson won four Stanley Cups with the Detroit Red Wings in the 1950s and set an N.H.L. record by appearing in 580 consecutive games.

headline.seo: Johnny Wilson, Durable Detroit Red Wing, Is Dead at 82
headline.main: Johnny Wilson, N.H.L. Star, Dies at 82; Held Consecutive-Game Record
headline.print_headline: Johnny Wilson, N.H.L. Star, 82; Held Consecutive-Game Record
